intro: Thespesia beata, commonly known as the sacred hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands and parts of Southeast Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters tall, featuring thick, waxy leaves and showy, pale yellow or white flowers. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Thespesia beata is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to salty and windy environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in traditional medicine and cultural practices.
